question.text: In acidic medium, <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> changes <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></math> to <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub></math> which has two <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>-</mo></mrow></mfenced></math> bonds Oxidation state of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></math> in <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub></math> is:

solution.text: Chromium forms six bonds with the oxygen atoms and oxygen is more electronegative than the chromium. Due to this chromium shows oxidation state in CrO5 is +6.
